thread.title: Report: Kings minority owners unhappy with direction of franchise
thread.title_full: Report: Kings minority owners unhappy with direction of franchise

author: Archaeologists discover secret tunnel in ancient Hittite castle
title: Report: Kings minority owners unhappy with direction of franchise
text:
Report: Kings minority owners unhappy with direction of franchise FOXSports 14 hrs ago © USA TODAY Sports Jun 3, 2013; Sacramento, CA, USA; Sacramento Kings owner Vivek Ranadive answers questions during a press conference at Sleep Train Arena. Mandatory Credit: Ed Szczepanski-USA TODAY Sports Almost anything would be better than the Sacramento Kings' previous owners, who very nearly took the team out of town. But things haven't been great under new majority owner Vivek Ranadive, whose attention to detail with the team could be considered meddlesome in the wrong light.
The Kings have gone through coaches and front office staff like tissue paper during Ranadive's tenure, though things seem to have settled (for now) with George Karl on the bench and Vlade Divac as general manager.
AdChoices
The turmoil to this point hasn't gone unnoticed by the Kings' other owners, according to a report from Grantland's Zach Lowe:
The franchise’s minority owners have been having pointed conversations over the last few months about Vivek Ranadivé’s stewardship, per league sources, but they are powerless to do anything under the franchise’s governing documents — unless Ranadivé accepts an offer to sell his controlling stake. If the Kings continue to be unstable, look for some of this noise to become public.
While the minority owners are "powerless," as Lowe writes, it's never a good thing when ownership disputes boil to the surface. Some amount of disagreement is healthy; tension, on the other hand, can paralyze a franchise.
